title: Julius Wolff (mathematician)
summary: Julius Wolff (18 April 1882 – 8 February 1945)[1] was a Dutch mathematician, known for the Denjoy–Wolff theorem and for his boundary version of the Schwarz lemma.[3][4][5] He perished in the Bergen-Belsen concentration camp in 1945, shortly before the camp was liberated.[6]
